com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub

Class PubSub

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.bullet.pubsub.PubSub
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RESTPubSub

    public abstract class PubSub
extends Object
    Notation: Partition is a unit of parallelism in the Pub/Sub queue. Implementations of PubSub should take in a BulletConfig and use the information to wire up and return Publishers and Subscribers.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  PubSub.Context
      The context determines how the Publisher and Subscriber returned by PubSub behave.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected BulletConfig config 
      protected PubSub.Context context 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructor and Description

      Instantiate a PubSub using parameters from BulletConfig.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static PubSub from(BulletConfig config)
      Create a PubSub instance using the class specified in the config file.
      abstract Publisher getPublisher()
      Get a Publisher instance wired to write to all allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context).
      abstract List<Publisher> getPublishers(int n)
      Get a list of n Publisher instances with the allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context) split as evenly as possible among them.
      <T> T getRequiredConfig(Class<T> clazz, String name)
      A method to get a required configuration of a particular type.
      abstract Subscriber getSubscriber()
      Get a Subscriber instance wired to read from all allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context).
      abstract List<Subscriber> getSubscribers(int n)
      Get a list of n Subscriber instances with allocated partitions from the appropriate queue (See context) split as evenly as possible among them.
      void switchContext(PubSub.Context context, BulletConfig config)
      Use this method to switch the PubSub.Context to another one.

    • Field Detail

      • context

        protected PubSub.Context context

      • config

        protected BulletConfig config

    • Constructor Detail

      • PubSub

        public PubSub(BulletConfig config)
       throws PubSubException
        Instantiate a PubSub using parameters from BulletConfig.
        Parameters:
        config - A non-null BulletConfig containing all required PubSub parameters.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if the context name is not present or cannot be parsed.

    • Method Detail

      • switchContext

        public void switchContext(PubSub.Context context,
                          BulletConfig config)
                   throws PubSubException
        Use this method to switch the PubSub.Context to another one.
        Parameters:
        context - A different context from the initial one.
        config - The BulletConfig containing any new required PubSub parameters. This will be merged with the existing config. Can be null.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if the context switch could not be done.

      • getPublisher

        public abstract Publisher getPublisher()
                                throws PubSubException
        Get a Publisher instance wired to write to all allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context).
        Returns:
        Publisher wired as required.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if the Publisher could not be created.

      • getPublishers

        public abstract List<Publisher> getPublishers(int n)
                                       throws PubSubException
        Get a list of n Publisher instances with the allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context) split as evenly as possible among them.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of Publishers requested.
        Returns:
        The List of n Publishers wired as required.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if Publishers could not be created.

      • getSubscriber

        public abstract Subscriber getSubscriber()
                                  throws PubSubException
        Get a Subscriber instance wired to read from all allocated partitions in the appropriate queue (See context).
        Returns:
        Subscriber wired as required.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if the Subscriber could not be created.

      • getSubscribers

        public abstract List<Subscriber> getSubscribers(int n)
                                         throws PubSubException
        Get a list of n Subscriber instances with allocated partitions from the appropriate queue (See context) split as evenly as possible among them.
        Parameters:
        n - The number of Subscribers requested.
        Returns:
        The List of n Subscribers wired as required.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if Subscribers could not be created.

      • from

        public static PubSub from(BulletConfig config)
                   throws PubSubException
        Create a PubSub instance using the class specified in the config file.
        Parameters:
        config - The non-null BulletConfig containing the class name and PubSub settings.
        Returns:
        an instance of specified class initialized with settings from the input file and defaults.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if PubSub creation fails.

      • getRequiredConfig

        public <T> T getRequiredConfig(Class<T> clazz,
                               String name)
                        throws PubSubException
        A method to get a required configuration of a particular type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type to cast the configuration to. Inferred from clazz.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the required configuration.
        clazz - The class of the required configuration.
        Returns:
        The extracted configuration of type T.
        Throws:
        PubSubException - if the configuration is missing or cannot be cast to type T.
